name: pnp-list-formatting-custom-header
title: Custom Header
shortDescription: Sometimes it is necessary to remove the standard headers. In those cases, you may still want to show a custom header. This sample demonstrates creating a custom header and only showing it on the first row. The key to this technique is setting the `display` style attribute to `none` (hidden) whenever the `@rowIndex` is not 0 (first row).
longDescription: Sometimes it is necessary to remove the standard headers. In those cases, you may still want to show a custom header. This sample demonstrates creating a custom header and only showing it on the first row. The key to this technique is setting the `display` style attribute to `none` (hidden) whenever the `@rowIndex` is not 0 (first row).

references.name: Use view formatting to customize SharePoint
references.description: You can use view formatting to customize how items in SharePoint lists and libraries are displayed. To do this, you construct a JSON object that describes the elements that are displayed when an item is loaded in a view and any styles to be applied to those elements.
